content.user_title: Deploy to Vercel with hybrid build pipeline
content.value_statement: Deploying hybrid applications with multiple frameworks requires careful build orchestration. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for Vercel deployments including Next.js, Docusaurus, and Python backend integration.
actual_capabilities: Guides hybrid Next.js and Docusaurus build process
Explains Vercel configuration with Python runtime
Describes API routing with Vercel rewrites
limitations: Does not modify project configuration files
Does not handle credentials or authentication

output_examples.input: How do I configure Vercel deployment for a hybrid Next.js and Docusaurus project?
output: The deployment uses a hybrid build script that first builds Docusaurus documentation, copies it to the Next.js public folder, then builds the main Next.js application.
The process runs: cd textbook && npm install && npm run build, then copies textbook/build/* to public/docs/, then runs next build.
Configure vercel.json with Python runtime for backend API routes.

best_practices: Set all required environment variables in Vercel Dashboard before deployment
Use vercel.json rewrites to route /api/* requests to Python functions
Test the hybrid build locally before deploying to Vercel
anti_patterns: Deploying without setting required environment variables
Using different build commands locally than in Vercel
Hardcoding API keys or secrets in configuration files

faq.question: Which Python version does Vercel support?
faq.answer: Vercel supports Python runtimes for serverless functions. Configure the version in vercel.json or project settings.

faq.question: What are the build size limits on Vercel?
faq.answer: Vercel has deployment size limits. Keep build outputs under 500MB for optimal performance.

faq.question: How do I connect a custom domain?
faq.answer: Add custom domains in Vercel Dashboard under Project Settings > Domains. DNS configuration required.

faq.question: Is my deployment data safe on Vercel?
faq.answer: Vercel encrypts data at rest and in transit. Never expose secrets in client-side code.

faq.question: Why did my deployment fail?
faq.answer: Check build logs in Vercel Dashboard. Common issues: missing env vars, build command errors, timeout limits.

faq.question: How does this compare to other platforms?
faq.answer: Vercel offers optimized Next.js support. Compared to AWS Amplify or Netlify, Vercel provides tighter Git integration and faster builds for Next.js projects.
